item.title: Collatz Arithmetic
item.description: Pick a natural number n and apply the following transformation to it: if n is even, the output will be n / 2; otherwise, if n is odd, the output will be 3n + 1. Keep doing this until 1 is reached.

item.title: You can do a lot with an empty file
item.description: Yesterday's post about "pipefail" also involved some systems which treated an empty file as a valid file. This turns out to be surprisingly common. I think people might be shocked at exactly how much you can get away with, and how many different things will accept such a beast.

item.title: In defense of simple architectures
item.description: Wave is a $1.7B company with 70 engineers1 whose product is a CRUD app that adds and subtracts numbers. In keeping with this, our architecture is a standard CRUD app architecture, a Python monolith on top of Postgres. Starting with a simple architecture and solving problems in simple ways where possible has allowed us to scale to this size while engineers mostly focus on work that delivers value to users.
